question_text: The normal reaction 'N' for a vehicle of 800 kg mass, negotiating a turn on a 30 degree banked road at maximum possible speed without skidding is x * 10^3 kg m/s^2. (Given cos 30 = 0.87, mu_s = 0.2)

A radioactive material decays by simultaneous emissions of two particles with half lives of 1400 years and 700 years respectively. What will be the time after which one third of the material remains? (Take ln 3 = 1.1)
The amount of heat needed to raise the temperature of 4 moles of a rigid diatomic gas from 0 C to 50 C when no work is done is (R is the universal gas constant):

A deuteron and an alpha particle having equal kinetic energy enter perpendicularly into a magnetic field. Let rd and r-alpha be their respective radii of circular path. The value of rd/r-alpha is equal to:
Ideally, for a simple pendulum of length L, the time period T is given by T = 2pi sqrt(L/g). If the length is increased by 4%, the percentage increase in time period is approximately:
A nucleus of mass M emits a gamma-ray photon of frequency 'v'. The loss of internal energy by the nucleus is: [Take 'c' as the speed of electromagnetic wave]

The radiation corresponding to 3 -> 2 transition of a hydrogen atom falls on a gold surface to generate photoelectrons. These electrons are passed through a magnetic field of 5 x 10^-4 T. Assume that the radius of the largest circular path followed by these electrons is 7 mm, the work function of the metal is: (Mass of electron = 9.1 x 10^-31 kg)

An electric dipole is placed at an angle of 30 degrees with an electric field intensity 2 x 10^5 N/C. It experiences a torque equal to 4 N m. The charge on the dipole, if the dipole length is 2 cm, is:

Region I and II are separated by a spherical surface of radius 25 cm. Refractive index of I is 1.25 and II is 1.4. An object is kept in region I at a distance of 40 cm from the surface. The distance of the image from the surface is:
Consider a mixture of gas molecule of types A, B and C having masses mA < mB < mC. The ratio of their root mean square speeds at normal temperature and pressure is:
If A and B are two vectors satisfying the relation A.B = |A x B|. Then the value of |A - B| will be:

The arm PQ of a rectangular conductor is moving from x=0 to x=2b outwards and then inwards from x=2b to x=0 in a uniform magnetic field acting from x=0 to x=b. The graph of flux variation with distance x will be:

options.Option 2: Linear increasing then constant then linear decreasing

question_text: The entropy of any system is given by S = alpha^2 beta ln[(mu k R)/(J beta^2) + 3]. Where alpha and beta are constants. mu, J, k and R are no. of moles, mechanical equivalent of heat, Boltzmann constant and gas constant respectively. Choose the incorrect option from the following:

options.Option 1: S, beta, k and mu R have the same dimensions.
options.Option 2: alpha and k have the same dimensions.
options.Option 3: S and alpha have different dimensions.
options.Option 4: alpha and J have the same dimensions.

question_text: AC voltage V(t) = 20 sin(omega t) of frequency 50Hz is applied to a parallel plate capacitor. The separation between the plates is 2mm and the area is 1 m^2. The amplitude of the oscillating displacement current for the applied AC voltage is (epsilon_0 = 8.85 x 10^-12 F/m):

A current of 5 A is passing through a non-linear magnesium wire of cross section 0.04 m^2. At every point the direction of current density is at an angle of 60 degrees with unit vector of area of cross-section. The magnitude of electric field at every point of the conductor is: (Resistivity of magnesium rho = 44 x 10^-8 ohm m)

The value of tension in a long thin metal wire has been changed from T1 to T2. The lengths of the metal wire at two different values of tension T1 and T2 are l1 and l2 respectively. The actual length of the metal wire is:
A butterfly is flying with a velocity 4sqrt(2) m/s in North-East direction. Wind is slowly blowing at 1 m/s from North to South. The resultant displacement of the butterfly in 3 seconds is:
A certain charge Q is divided into parts q and (Q-q). How should the charges Q and q be divided so that q and (Q-q) placed at a certain distance apart experience maximum electrostatic repulsion?

A steel block of 10 kg rests on a horizontal floor. When three iron cylinders are placed on it, the block and cylinders go down with an acceleration 0.2 m/s^2. The normal reaction R' by the floor if mass of the iron cylinders are equal and of 20kg each, is (g=10 m/s^2):

A person whose mass is 100 kg travels from Earth to Mars in a spaceship. Neglect all other objects in sky and take acceleration due to gravity on the surface of the Earth and Mars as 10 m/s^2 and 4 m/s^2 respectively. Identify the curve that fits best for the weight of the passenger as a function of time.

options.Option 1: Curve starting at 1000N, decreasing to 0, then increasing to 400N

question_text: Ideally, a spring gun has spring constant 100 N/m. A small ball 'B' of mass 100 g is put in its barrel by compressing the spring through 0.05 m. The ball leaves the gun horizontally at a height of 2 m above the ground. The horizontal distance 'd' traveled by the ball is x meter. Value of x is:
The amplitude of wave disturbance propagating in the positive x-direction is given by y = 1/(1+x^2) at t=0 and y = 1/(1+(x-2)^2) at t=1s. The velocity of the wave is x m/s. Value of x is:
In a heat engine, the heat energy absorbed by a system in going through a cyclic process shown as a circle on P-V diagram (Diameter 20 kPa and 20 Litre) is x pi Joules. The value of x is:
The frequency of a car horn encountered a change from 400 Hz to 500 Hz, when the car approaches a vertical wall. If the speed of sound is 330 m/s. Then the speed of car is x km/h. Value of x is:

A body having specific charge 8 microC/g is resting on a frictionless plane at a distance 10cm from the wall. It starts moving towards the wall when a uniform electric field of 100 V/m is applied horizontally towards the wall. If the collision is elastic, the time period of motion is x seconds. Value of x is:

An object viewed from a near point distance of 25 cm, using a microscopic lens with magnification '6', gives an unresolved image. A resolved image is observed at infinite distance with a total magnification double the earlier using an eyepiece along with the given lens and a tube of length 0.6 m, if the focal length of the eyepiece is x cm. Value of x is:

In an LCR series circuit, an inductor 30 mH and a resistor 1 ohm are connected to an AC source of angular frequency 300 rad/s. The value of capacitance for which the current leads the voltage by 45 degrees is 1/x * 10^-3 F. Then the value of x is:

A circular disc reaches from top to bottom of an inclined plane of length 'L'. When it slips down the plane, it takes time t1. When it rolls down the plane, it takes time t2. The value of t2/t1 is sqrt(3/x). The value of x will be:

A carrier wave Vc(t) = 160 sin(2pi x 10^6 t) volts is made to vary between Vmax = 200 V and Vmin = 120 V by a message signal Vm(t) = Am sin(2pi x 10^3 t) volts. The peak voltage Am of the modulating signal is x V. Value of x is:

A rod of mass M and length L is lying on a horizontal frictionless surface. A particle of mass 'm' travelling along the surface hits at one end of the rod with a velocity 'u' in a direction perpendicular to the rod. The collision is completely elastic. After collision, particle comes to rest. The ratio of masses m/M is 1/x. The value of x is:

Given below are two statements: One is labelled as Assertion A and the other is labelled as Reason R. Assertion A: The dihedral angles in H2O2 in gaseous phase is 111.5 deg and in solid phase is 90.2 deg. Reason R: The change in dihedral angle in solid and gaseous phase is due to the difference in the intermolecular forces. Choose the most appropriate answer from the options given below for A and R.

options.Option 1: A is correct but R is not correct.
options.Option 2: Both A and R are correct but R is not the correct explanation of A.
options.Option 3: Both A and R are correct and R is the correct explanation of A
options.Option 4: A is not correct but R is correct.

question_text: Which one of the following compounds will provide a tertiary alcohol on reaction with excess of CH3MgBr followed by hydrolysis?

In the reaction of hypobromite with amide (Hoffmann Bromamide Degradation), the carbonyl carbon is lost as:

options.Option 1: Primary amine, nitrile compound, conc. HCl
options.Option 2: Primary amine, isonitrile compound, conc. HCl
options.Option 3: Secondary amine, isonitrile compound, conc NaOH
options.Option 4: Secondary amine, nitrile compound, conc. NaOH

question_text: Among the given species, the Resonance stabilized carbocations are: (A) Benzyl carbocation (B) Allyl carbocation (C) Cyclohexyl carbocation (D) Methyl carbocation.
A s-block element (M) reacts with oxygen to form an oxide of the formula MO2. The oxide is pale yellow in color and paramagnetic. The element (M) is:
Green chemistry in day-to-day life is in the use of:

options.Option 2: Large amount of water alone for washing clothes
options.Option 3: Liquified CO2 for dry cleaning of clothes

question_text: Identify the incorrect statement from the following:

options.Option 2: Amylose is a branched chain polymer of glucose
options.Option 3: Starch is a polymer of alpha-D glucose
options.Option 4: Glycogen is called as animal starch

question_text: The metal that can be purified economically by fractional distillation method is:
The set in which compounds have different nature is:

The conditions given below are in the context of observing Tyndall effect in colloidal solutions: (a) Diameter of colloidal particles is comparable to wavelength. (b) Diameter is much smaller. (c) Diameter is much larger. (d) Refractive indices are comparable. (e) Refractive indices are very different. Choose the correct conditions:

Cyclohexene reaction with (1) KMnO4/H2SO4/Heat gives 'A'. Cyclohexene reaction with (2) KMnO4/H2O/273K gives 'B'. Identify A and B.

options.Option 1: A and B are dicarboxylic acids
options.Option 2: A is dicarboxylic acid, B is diol
options.Option 3: A is diol, B is dicarboxylic acid

question_text: An inorganic compound 'X' with conc. H2SO4 gives brown fumes and brown ring with FeSO4. 'X' solution with H2S gives ppt 'Y'. 'Y' with conc. HNO3 and excess NH4OH gives deep blue solution. 'X' is:

A and B decompose via first order kinetics with half-lives 54.0 min and 18.0 min respectively. Starting from an equimolar non reactive mixture of A and B, the time taken for the concentration of A to become 16 times that of B is x min. Value of x is:
